documenttitle.text: Red Hat Security Advisory: openssl security update

note.text:
An update for openssl is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
note.title: Topic

note.text:
OpenSSL is a toolkit that implements the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) and Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocols, as well as a full-strength general-purpose cryptography library.

Security Fix(es):

* openssl: c_rehash script allows command injection (CVE-2022-1292)

* openssl: the c_rehash script allows command injection (CVE-2022-2068)

* openssl: AES OCB fails to encrypt some bytes (CVE-2022-2097)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

note.text: openssl: c_rehash script allows command injection
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

For the update to take effect, all services linked to the OpenSSL library must be restarted, or the system rebooted.

reference.Description: bz#2081494: CVE-2022-1292 openssl: c_rehash script allows command injection

acknowledgment.Description: Upstream acknowledges Elison Niven (Sophos) as the original reporter.
